CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 6, 1962, pg. 9, reads: "CUTTING CAKE - Mr. and Mrs. Richard Wilson Jr. cut the first slice of their wedding cake, following their recent marriage in home of the bride's parents. The bride is the former Miss Valeria Leona Wilson, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Eugenie Wilson of Pittsburgh. - Harris Photo."  Article reads: "The Wilsons are Wed in Home Rites - During a recent ceremony at the home of the bride's parents, Miss Valeria Leona Wilsons [sic] repeated nuptial vows with Richard Wilson Jr. The Rev. William J. Harvey III, officiated the rites.  The bride is the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Eugene Wilson of Somers Drive.  THe groom's parents are Mr. and Mrs. Richard Wilson Sr.  The bride, a recent graduate of Fifth Avenue High School, was given in marriage by her father.  She wore a street length dress of pale blue satin brocade, styled with a basque bodice, short sleeves, bateau neckline and wrapped lined bell skirt. Her veil of illusion was attached to a pillbox of yellow pom-poms.  For the wedding, the bride's home was decorated with lovely fall flowers."
TitMainTitle: Groom Richard Wilson Jr. wearing tuxedo and light colored bow tie, and bride Valeria Leona Wilson wearing short sleeved brocade dress and veil, cutting three tiered wedding cake, in dining room of Wilson home on Somers Drive
